name: deimosrising
text: Though it has rarely been acknowledged by the fanbase, Ray's early characterization is as a very intimidating sort of person. His later feats are less surprising in this light.

name: rowboat
text: He's frontin'. He's a player. This is how he comes off to anyone who meets him for the first time, not least readers.

name: kamet
text: Yah, the true badasses are scary when you first meet them.  You don't know whether or not you like them, SHOULD like them, or even whether or not you should even be in their presence.. it's great.

name: puguglypress
text: It's awesome, because we as readers learn that Ray is kind of a joke at about the same rate that we would learn that about him in real life.

name: kingcrimson
text: Why does this comment not have more chubbies? It's one of the most insightful things I've seen on here.

name: puguglypress
text: Thank you! I usually come late to the party. Unless this was not directed at me, in which case not thank you.

name: kingcrimson
text:
Straight up to you. One of my favourite parts about Achewood is that all the characters are portrayed in both positive and negative lights. It makes them feel so much more real.

Ray is one of the best for this. So is Cornelius. And Teodor.

name: puguglypress
text: Yeah, I think one of the reasons everyone was complaining so much about Achewood "sucking" last year was that there were like three storyarcs in a row where the only message was "look how cool/badass this character is" (Cornelius and Polly spring to mind). Todd arcs, of course, never have this problem, as it is impossible to portray Todd in a positive light.

name: hereward
text: people do not want to acknowledge that ray is both badass and a joke.

name: farqussus
text: I get an 'Ordell Robbie' kind of feeling. All the elements of badass. Not very good at it.

name: ambala
text: I can't imagine being afraid of Ray.  Nice Pete, on the other hand...

name: anomalous3
text: You imagine Ray talking like Isaac Hayes, but maybe not quite as badass. Having one's brain suspended in dutch ethanol takes the edge off a guy.

name: closefriend
text: No matter how hard I try, my brain tells me his voice is done by Cheech. I don't understand why.

name: shoinan
text: Definitely like Isaac Hayes but not as low-pitched. And not as scientologist either.

name: snoozebar
text:
Isaac Hayes is a Scientologist?

NOOOO...MY WORLD IS SHATTERED

name: kledermans
text: Yeah.  They killed off Chef because Hayes quit South Park after they made fun of Scientology.

name: shoinan
text:
It's kind of self-righteous of him to quit the show because it offended him, after South Park offended countless bazillions of others.

In conclusion, Ray is much cooler than Isaac Hayes.

name: coldfrog
text: Supposedly he was forced to quit by other Scientologists.  This bothers me.

name: pox
text: Scientology bothers everyone.

name: foetus_punch
text:
Guys, as a scientologist, I am very offended by this. My fellow scientologists keep telling me to quit achewood, and they won't listen when I tell them it's not a job and I need to Dianitize my thetans. Anyway, I'm leaving!

Seriously, the only Scientologist I ever knew was my friends dad, who yelled at us all because we were talking about Scientology like it may or may not be valid. I was actually playing the devil's advocate, saying it could be valid, yet he chose me for his zealous rantings. He told me I was and idiot with a small vocabulary, and tried to convince me that Scientology would cure me.

He also called "the world's only white nigger" and asked my friend why he was hanging out with a white nigger.

name: sharpdresseddan
text: We all have a friend with a father like that.

name: foetus_punch
text:
Jesus H. Shova, I just read through what I wrote up there and it is nigh-incomprehensible. I am so very, very sorry.

P.S: There was a Chinese kid who was with us who hid behind the couch when he came in and who started blubbering after he left because the crazed man had repeatedly talked about how much he "pitied the chinks". The kid was really shook up.

name: greenkoolayd
text: so he bitched at the kid who wasnt even bashing scientology, while belittling asians?

name: fermatprime
text: NOT ANYMORE HE ISN'T

name: nexus
text: A CLOSE SHAVE.

name: estutius
text: Dudes Mutiny: Averted.

name: baryonyx
text: In which Ray is the metaphorical Knit-o-matic, and Teodor is on the conveyor belt.

name: hamscout
text: Soon, Beef will have A Grand Day Out !

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: Ray in his Bad ass cat days!

name: deancain29
text: although not present in this strip - I would imagine in a movie version of Achewood John Lithgow would play Mr Bear.

name: girlandagun
text: I was thinking Frasier for Mr Bear. Nice Pete would be Crispin Glover.

name: achewoodno1fan
text: dude that fourth panel.. a picture says a thousand words

name: dicklaurent
text: I hear all these people, you see. And they're talking about their Achewood moment. Well that panel was mine. Anyway, someone mentioned that he talks like Iisac Hayes. Even to this day, especially in the Man, Why You GotTo DoA Thing? interview, he sounds to me like Miles Davis during interviews conducted by white people.

name: relaxing
text: extremely hoarse?

name: crinklebat
text: Achewood prompted me to buy my first bottle of Ketel One. I feel like that is kind of a big deal.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Hah, when i read through the first time, I didn't know Ray. T I WAS NERVOUS WITH YOU.

name: _cheesekayke
text: For half of this strip, Teodor is slightly decapitated. It worries me.

name: overmedicated
text: Yeah, like Ray would ever run out of olives.

name: saddestking
text: Ray is not a cat who thinks things through.  Ray is a cat who buys olives based on some kind of dice voodoo, and has a cool-sounding reason why he is out of olives but really it was because he did poorly at craps last night and although he could buy more olives he is ashamed to do so.

name: phthoggos
text: RB has not yet written olive_minder.exe

name: boscostacy
text: Panel Four: Ray gets his Swearengen face on.

name: vice
text:
Ray looks at him. He looks at T?odor and he knows that he lied

Looks like T?odor got audited.

name: nucleargeranium
text: I think that the making fun of Scientology was only part of the puzzle that made Isaac Hayes quit. He also was very offended/refused to appear in the south park episode with the the virgin mary bleeding out the... hiney...

name: goocifer
text: So wait, if a cat like Ray is posing a question such as this, what's the right answer?  Olive or a twist?

name: phthoggos
text:
The joke is that Teodor knows nothing about martinis, or alcoholic drinks at all. He is completely bluffing (and honestly, we've all been there).

Normally, either an olive or a twist of lemon would be considered acceptable.

name: zapatos
text: Well looking at the cookbook, it seems Ray prefers a twist.

name: ham_shoes
text: Is this some Schrodinger's Cat thing?  cuz I'm surprised you didn't trigger a 1000-post thread that is impossible to read

name: goocifer
text: Early Achewood Ray is intimidating and if he didn't like you he would have called you a fancy man if you wanted a twist, but if you had said you wanted an olive he would have accused you of being of low class.  If 2002 Ray doesn't like you, there are no right answers.

name: hyetal
text: My experience with Ketel One was not a good one. I don't know why Ray keeps going back to it. Now, Luksusowa? That's vodka.

name: jaredwilde
text:
And yet we all know that there is only one true vodka, and that vodka is Belvedere.

However, if I forgot to knock over a bank that day, Svedka is a wonderful, reasonably priced brand.

name: snowman
text: I love this strip.  I think it could benefit from a few more panels, just to better illustrate the awkwardness of this exchange.  Still amazing, though.

name: rowboat
text: For some reason, this of all strips is the one which really drove home for me (and JUST NOW!) the fact that their mouths used not to move when they spoke. I wonder when the bottom lip first became a separate, moving thing. One of you must know.

name: rabbidpanda
text: When Onstad held the AIM chat event (I believe it's only happened once) he remarked to someone there that he had, at that point in time, given all but one of his characters moving mouths.  I never saved the conversation, and it's my greatest regret.

name: speth
text: ketel 1 is good

name: hamscout
text:
I love the awkward pause--I swear that if you stare at Panel 4 long enough, Ray's head moves further and further from his body!
And poor, virginal Teodor coming apart like he's wearing a wire...

name: axhoola
text: Ray is someone you can hang with.

name: comrade_tom
text: WOULD YOU LIKE SOME FRITTATA?

name: ham_shoes
text: Do I detect a hint of sass from Teodor in Panel 1?  It seems like he was about to say "Yeah, that's good... rat piss."

name: foea
text: No, you don't.

name: carlyle
text: I think he saw the pause and the eyebrows and simply assumed.

name: miaou
text:
Bought this guy an hour ago.
[IMGS OFF]

Now I have alcoholism.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
chubbied.

(yes, it is rad to have alcoholism, Internet.)

name: fineoakstructure
text: keep it in the freezer
